hints.content: We have two tapes that are the same length. Let's start by writing an expression for the length of each tape.
The top tape has a length of $35$ units.

The bottom tape has $5$ parts, each with a length of $d$ units.

The total length of the bottom tape is $5\times d$ units, which we can simplify to $5d$ units.

So, the tape diagram shows us $35=5d$.

The section labeled $d$ is $\dfrac{1}{5}$ the length of the $35$ unit long tape.

$d=\dfrac{35}{5}=?$

question.content:
The tape diagram represents an equation.  

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/be2ec10575508ea76872f8c82cacab968375083f)

**Find the value of $d$  that makes the equation true.**

$d=$ [[â˜ƒ numeric-input 1]]
